IllformedLocaleException(java.lang.Strin.Description: Constructs a new IllformedLocaleException with the given message and -1 as the error index.

getErrorIndex().Description: Returns the index where the error was found. A negative value indicates either the error index is not applicable or unknown.

IllformedLocaleException(java.lang.Strin.Description: Constructs a new IllformedLocaleException with the given message and the error index. The error index is the approximate offset from the start of the ill-formed value to the point where the parse first detected an error. A negative error index value indicates either the error index is not applicable or unknown.

IllformedLocaleException().Description: Constructs a new IllformedLocaleException with no detail message and -1 as the error index.

IllformedLocaleException(java.lang.Strin.Description: Constructs a new IllformedLocaleException with the given message and the error index. The error index is the approximate offset from the start of the ill-formed value to the point where the parse first detected an error. A negative error index value indicates either the error index is not applicable or unknown.

ClassDesc: Thrown by methods in @B_android#icu#util#ULocale_E@ and @B_android#icu#util#ULocale#Builder_E@ to indicate that an argument is not a well-formed BCP 47 tag.
